docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Your ''On the Brink'' series (front page, March 20, 26 and 31) calls attention to neglected diseases of forgotten people.
docs.abstract: Former Pres Jimmy Carter letter applauds 'On the Brink' series that calls attention to neglected diseases of some poor countries (March 20, 26, 31)
docs.snippet: To the Editor:     Your ''On the Brink'' series (front page, March 20, 26 and 31) calls attention to neglected diseases of forgotten people.

docs.lead_paragraph: A study lends support to the theory that eating less may benefit even the non-obese.

headline.main: Low-Calorie Diet May Lead to Longer Life
headline.print_headline: Low-Calorie Diet May Lead To Longer Life, Study Finds

docs.snippet: A study lends support to the theory that eating less may benefit even the non-obese.

docs.lead_paragraph: As evidenced in the Broadway play "Well," many people believe that if you do everything "right," bad things won't happen.

headline.main: When the Symptoms Don't Lead to Easy Answers
headline.print_headline: When the Symptoms Don't Lead to Easy Answers

docs.snippet: As evidenced in the Broadway play "Well," many people believe that if you do everything "right," bad things won't happen.

docs.lead_paragraph: Novartis, Switzerland's largest drug maker, raised its offer for the rest of the Chiron Corporation by more than $200 million yesterday, to about $5.33 billion, winning the support of at least two major institutional shareholders that had been opposed. Novartis raised its bid for the 56 percent of Chiron that it does not already own to $48 a share, from $45, Chiron said.
docs.abstract: Novartis raises its bid for remaining 56 percent stake in Chiron Corp by more than $200 million, to about $5.33 billion; CAM North America and ValueAct Capital, major institutional shareholders that opposed previous bid as too low, say they would support deal (S)
